title: CryptoNight Coins - Mining with Regular Computers
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Analysis of CryptoNight algorithm coins that democratized mining by enabling CPU mining when Bitcoin and Litecoin had become ASIC-dominated

phase_2_gpu.advantage: Massive parallel processing vs sequential CPU

phase_3_asic.result: CPUs completely pointless - electricity cost exceeds returns
phase_3_asic.barrier: Must have ASICs, and a lot of them

litecoin_feathercoin.initial_promise: Scrypt algorithm resistant to Bitcoin ASICs
litecoin_feathercoin.eventual_fate: Scrypt ASICs developed, same centralization occurred

dogecoin.launch: By the time DOGE came out, farms already existed

cryptonight_solution.core_innovation: Algorithm designed to be CPU-mineable only

gpu_support.possible: Yes, with special software like Claymore miner
gpu_support.caveat: Dramatically reduced hash rate compared to CPU

cryptonight_solution.democratization: Anyone with a computer can mine profitably again
cryptonight_solution.multi_computer_profit: Running a few computers can generate actual profit if electricity is reasonable

server_mining_theory.speculation: Could modify servers specifically for CryptoNight mining
server_mining_theory.use_case: If you have 100 servers for a week/month, could mine significant amounts

example_coin.name: HoldCoin
example_coin.note: Some people have been mining this on servers

cryptonote_ecosystem.definition: Coins based on CryptoNight algorithm with variations

dashcoin.note: Not to be confused with DASH (X11)

steem_comparison.mechanism: Because it's delegated, no advantage to ASICs
steem_comparison.implication: Different approach to democratization than CryptoNight

cloud_mining_potential.concept: Mine CryptoNotes using cloud virtual machines

profitability.cryptonotes: Could be profitable due to CPU-friendly algorithm

resources: nextofwindows.com - How to create VM on Azure to mine
cloud_mining_potential.vision: Server coin or Ubuntu coin could change cryptocurrency

demographic_expansion.thesis: CPU mining brings new demographics to cryptocurrency
demographic_expansion.result: Anyone with a computer becomes potential miner

clarification_needed.point: Dash and Monero are not CPU-only coins
clarification_needed.correction: Original post updated to clarify servers CAN mine them, not that they're exclusive

technical_correction.point: RAM doesn't matter as much as cache
technical_correction.detail: Need at least 2MB cache per CPU core
technical_correction.caveat: Many mainstream CPUs don't have enough cache
technical_correction.conclusion: More accessible than Bitcoin, but not truly everyman's coin

prediction_accuracy.asic_resistance_failure: Eventually Monero faced ASIC pressure, had to fork
prediction_accuracy.cloud_mining: Did become a thing, mostly scams though

quiz_questions.q: Why did CPU mining become pointless for Bitcoin?
quiz_questions.a: ASICs made electricity cost more than mining returns
quiz_questions.explanation: Specialized hardware outperformed general CPUs by orders of magnitude
The algorithm is the 'weakness' of ASIC miners

quiz_questions.q: Why is STEEM somewhat CPU-friendly despite not using CryptoNight?
quiz_questions.a: Delegated Proof-of-Stake means no advantage to specialized hardware
quiz_questions.explanation: Block frequency is same regardless of mining power

quiz_questions.q: What hardware spec matters most for CryptoNight mining?
quiz_questions.a: CPU cache (at least 2MB per core), not RAM
quiz_questions.explanation: Community correction noted many mainstream CPUs lack sufficient cache

quiz_questions.q: What was the vision for 'Server coins'?
quiz_questions.a: Coins optimized for server/cloud mining to democratize access
quiz_questions.explanation: Anyone with cloud access could participate in mining
